titleStmt.author: Meigs, Return Jonathan

It may be used freely by individuals for research, teaching, and personal use as long as this statement of availability is included in the text. For all other use contact the Special Collections Librarian, Hoskins Library, University of Tennessee, 1401 Cumberland Avenue, Knoxville, TN 37996. (865) 974-4480.

bibl.title: [Receipt] 1807 Aug. 29, United States to Daniel McCoy / Return J. Meigs
bibl.author: Meigs, Return Jonathan
bibl.note: This document is a receipt for payment of $50.00 to Daniel McCoy for 20 spinning wheels made for the Cherokee Indians. Return J. Meigs, agent for the War Department in Tennessee made the payment on behalf of the United States.

projectDesc.p: Created for the University of Tennessee Digital Library

editorialDecl.p: Quotation marks retained as data except inside q tags
Errors in transcription of the printed text controlled with X-Metal 2.1 spell-checker; text has also been thoroughly proofread.
Corrections and normalization represented by editorial tags.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

refsDecl.p: ID attributes provided for only those pages, chapters, or illustrations toward which a reference or figure points.

div1.p: This is to certify that Daniel McCoy made Twenty Passible Spinning wheels agreeable to my judgment and that Mr. John Gunter has delivered them unto such Indian Families as he thought would make proper use of them, which said wheels were delivered In my presence George Wolfe

Received of Return J. Meigs fifty dollars in full payment of the above account.
Highwassee 29th August
1807
David Files
div1.closer:
Duplicates signed
John his X mark Gunter Atty
Daniel McCoys'
Receipt $50.00
29th August 1807
